The Shawshank State Penitentiary, also known as the Ohio State Reformatory, is a historic prison building in Mansfield, Ohio. While it is no longer operational as a prison, it has been used as a filming location for several movies and TV shows. Here are some of the most popular movies that were filmed in Shawshank State Penitentiary:

1. The Shawshank Redemption (1994) - This highly acclaimed drama film, directed by Frank Darabont, tells the story of two prisoners who become friends and find a way to escape from the prison. The movie stars Tim Robbins and Morgan Freeman, and features several scenes filmed inside the prison.
2. The Green Mile (1999) - Based on Stephen King's novel of the same name, this fantasy drama film directed by Frank Darabont follows a death row supervisor who develops a bond with a condemned man who possesses supernatural healing powers. The film features several scenes filmed in the prison's death row and execution chamber.
3. Air Force One (1997) - In this action-thriller film directed by Wolfgang Petersen, the prison serves as a stand-in for a Russian prison where the President of the United States (played by Harrison Ford) is held captive.
4. The Silence of the Lambs (1991) - This psychological horror film directed by Jonathan Demme features a scene where FBI trainee Clarice Starling (played by Jodie Foster) visits a prison to interview a serial killer. While the scene was filmed at a different location, the prison's exterior was used as a establishing shot.
5. Tango & Cash (1989) - This buddy cop action comedy film directed by Andrei Konchalovsky features a scene where the two main characters, played by Sylvester Stallone and Kurt Russell, are imprisoned in a fictionalized version of Shawshank State Penitentiary.

These are just a few examples of movies that have used Shawshank State Penitentiary as a filming location. The prison's unique and atmospheric architecture has made it a popular choice for filmmakers looking to shoot on location.
